intro: Verbascum × blattarioides var. pseudoblattaria, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Verbascum genus.
